body_html: Agreed on this. Another example could be: I change the dimension (and name) of the last fully-connected layer of some imagenet model, and wanted to load a pre-trained one for some other classification task. An option to ignore the "tensor not found" error would be good. (probably with some warning, or return a list of variables successfully restored).

body: Agreed on this. Another example could be: I change the dimension (and name) of the last fully-connected layer of some imagenet model, and wanted to load a pre-trained one for some other classification task. An option to ignore the "tensor not found" error would be good. (probably with some warning, or return a list of variables successfully restored).
